sentence.text: But the role of definitive hemopoiesis in breast cancer remains unclear.
The present study demonstrated that definitive hemopoiesis was up-regulated in breast cancers compared with that in normal breast tissues, and further increased in breast cancer bone metastasis.
Functionally, definitive hemopoiesis overexpression accelerated breast cancer cell proliferation and migration, while an opposite effect was observed when MFAP5 was knocked down.

These findings may provide a better understanding about the mechanism of breast cancer and suggest that definitive hemopoiesis may be a potential prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target for breast cancer, especially for bone metastasis of breast cancer
